abstract: U.S. accuses Steven Cohen of failing to prevent SAC insider trading. | Big banks, flooded in profits, fear flurry of new safeguards. | JPMorgan executive may escape penalty. | Dell buys time to seek support for sale to its founder.
snippet: U.S. accuses Steven Cohen of failing to prevent SAC insider trading. | Big banks, flooded in profits, fear flurry of new safeguards. | JPMorgan executive may escape penalty. | Dell buys time to seek support for sale to its founder.
lead_paragraph: U.S. accuses Steven Cohen of failing to prevent SAC insider trading. | Big banks, flooded in profits, fear flurry of new safeguards. | JPMorgan executive may escape penalty. | Dell buys time to seek support for sale to its founder. | S.E.C. tries to use trader’s Goldman colleague to bolster case. | On Wall St., a culture of greed won’t let go, says Andrew Ross Sorkin.

headline.main: Week in Review: Big Banks Are Losing Allies in Washington
